page.title: 03Rawmarsh area news : 24-5-85
page.content:
{Education}Strike action by members of the largest teaching union affected hundreds of Rotherham schoolchildren this week. The{National Union of {Teachers}called out its members at Swinton and Brinsworth Comprehensive Schools and Kiveton Park Meadows Junior School in pursuit of its wage claim.
{The Coal Industry}Mr Peter Hardy, the M.P. for Wentworth, says the N.C.B. is flouting an agreement made between the Pit Deputies union, N.A.C.O.D.S., and the government. He claims the Board is ignoring the spirit of the agreement made during the miner's strike and warned that the deputies were becoming angry and frustrated because now only collieries already exhausted could be part of the N.C.B. review procedure.
